subject: Re: [junit] Enhancement Request: Assert.fail(Exception e) could be useful.
msgSnippet: ... How is public void testWhatever() { try { // ... some test code ... } catch (SomeException e) { fail(e); } } better than just declaring the test to be able
messageBody:
On Tuesday 20 January 2004 03:54, operationsresearch wrote:
> The following method could be useful..
> public static void fail(Exception e)
> Fails a test with a message containing stack trace of given exception.

How is

public void testWhatever() {
try {
// ... some test code ...
}
catch (SomeException e) {
fail(e);
}
}

better than just declaring the test to be able to throw SomeException?

public void testWhateverThrowing() throws SomeException {
// ... same test code as from try block above ...
}


Robert
